title: Latest Galaxy S26 leak suggests how it may be different from the now-dropped Pro
summary: And not-so-different from the Galaxy S25.
body: Credit: Android Headlines TL;DR Samsung is reportedly changing the dimensions of the base Galaxy S26. Unlike the previously reported slimming that Pro was slated to undergo, the vanilla Galaxy S26 will have dimensions comparable to the Galaxy S25. This might allow for better thermal performance, camera improvements, or improved battery life. The Galaxy S26 isn‚Äôt expected to launch until February, but leaks have continued to flow in at a steady pace. Earlier today, the Galaxy S26 Plus leaked in its iPhone 17 Pro-esque orange hue. Right along with the bigger sibling, we‚Äôre also witnessing the regular Galaxy S26 leak in digital renders. This isn‚Äôt the first time we‚Äôve witnessed the Galaxy S26 leak. The difference, however, is that back when we first saw these renders, it was expected to be called the Galaxy S26 Pro as part of Samsung‚Äôs intended reshuffle for the lineup. However, with Samsung correcting course and returning to the original lineup , we‚Äôre now expecting the smaller model to release as Galaxy S26 ‚Äî sans the ‚ÄúPro‚Äù suffix.

title: Morgan Wallen, Garth Brooks, Taylor Swift & More Artists With Most Weeks at No. 1 on Top Country Albums Chart: Full¬†List
summary: Male solo artists dominate, though three female solo artists and two groups have also achieved the feat.
body: Morgan Wallen ‚Äôs I’m the Problem leads Billboard ‘s Top Country Albums chart (dated Nov. 15) for the 25th consecutive week. This ups Wallen’s career tally of weeks at No. 1 to 211, allowing him to extend his lead as the artist with the most weeks at No. 1 in the chart’s 61-year history. Wallen‚Äôs achievement is especially impressive because he has amassed this hefty total of weeks at No. 1 in such a short amount of time. He first topped the chart on Aug. 15, 2020. Top Country Albums originated as Hot Country Albums in the Jan. 11, 1964 issue of Billboard . Johnny Cash ‚Äôs Ring of Fire (The Best of Johnny Cash) headed the inaugural chart. The compilation was well-timed: ‚ÄúRing of Fire‚Äù had headed Hot Country Songs for seven weeks the previous summer and had crossed over to reach the top 20 on the Billboard Hot 100. The chart was named Hot Country LP‚Äôs from 1968 to 1984, when vinyl LPs were king. Twenty-one artists have logged 50 or more weeks at No. 1 on Top Country Albums. Male solo artists dominate, as you might expect, though three female solo artists have achieved the feat, as have two groups. (One of those groups is an all-female group.) Only one Black art‚Ä¶

title: Brandon Lake Wins ASCAP 2025 Christian Music Songwriter of the Year: Full Winners¬†List
summary: Essential Music Publishing received the ASCAP Christian music publisher of the year award.
body: Brandon Lake was named ASCAP‚Äôs Christian music songwriter of the year on Monday (Nov. 10), while ‚ÄúPraise,‚Äù which he co-wrote with Pat Barrett, was named Christian music song of the year. ASCAP‚Äôs winning Christian and country music writers will be honored at the ASCAP Nashville Songwriters Celebration on Monday, Nov. 17. Related How Brandon Lake Is Bringing New Fans to ‚ÄòWhat’s Real and What‚Äôs True‚Äô in Christian Music Foo Fighters Announce Dates For 2026 Take Cover European Stadium Tour Jonas Brothers Will Ring in 2026 With New Year's Eve Special From Florida This is Lake‚Äôs second ASCAP Christian Music songwriter of the year honor, having previously taken the title in 2023. In 2024, he was named ASCAP Christian songwriter/artist of the Year. Lake‚Äôs most-performed songs include ‚ÄúPraise,‚Äù ‚ÄúHard Fought Hallelujah‚Äù and ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs Who I Praise.‚Äù Lake, 35, has received five Grammys and last week received three nominations for the upcoming 68th Annual Grammy Awards. Lake has also collected 15 GMA Dove Awards and three Billboard Music Awards and is nominated for musical event of the year (with Jelly Roll ) for ‚ÄúHard Fought Hallelujah‚Äù at the upcoming CMA Awards. ‚ÄúPraise,‚Äù the A‚Ä¶

title: Pharrell‚Äôs Adidas ‚ÄòJellyfish‚Äô Named Shoe of the Year at 2025¬†FNAAs
summary: The ‚ÄúShoe Oscars‚Äù are set for December 3 at Cipriani 25 Broadway in New York City.
body: Pharrell Williams is walking away with one of the footwear world‚Äôs highest honors. The multihyphenate artist, producer, and designer will receive the Shoe of the Year award at the 2025 Footwear News Achievement Awards (FNAAs) , it was announced Monday (Nov. 10), in recognition of his bold and boundary-pushing Virginia Adistar Jellyfish collaboration with Adidas. ‚ÄúI dreamed of a shoe that felt alive, something that moved like water, that had its own rhythm, energy and glow,‚Äù Williams said in a statement. ‚ÄúThe Virginia Adistar Jellyfish started as a really big idea that we kept pushing, shaping, refining until it became real. I wanted it to feel fluid, futuristic, and free‚Äînot just another shoe but a living design.‚Äù The sneaker, which quickly became a streetwear standout this year, fuses performance-ready materials with visual design inspired by aquatic life. Its sculptural silhouette and luminous finish made it one of the most talked-about shoes in 2025 ‚Äî and one of Adidas‚Äô most ambitious collaborative launches to date. ‚ÄúPharrell‚Äôs partnership with Adidas continues to redefine what creative collaboration in footwear can look like,‚Äù said Michael Atmore, chief brand officer of Fairch‚Ä¶

body: Carlos Vives is gearing up to shine brighter than ever with his Tour Al Sol, Billboard Espa√±ol can exclusively announce today (Nov. 10). The Colombian superstar‚Äôs upcoming North American tour, kicking off on April 16, will celebrate more than three decades of his illustrious career by revisiting timeless hits from his seminal albums Cl√°sicos de La Provincia (1994) and La Tierra del Olvido (1995), as well as songs from the newly reimagined La Tierra del Olvido 30 A√±os (Remastered & Expanded) , released in July. ‚ÄúEach show of Tour al Sol will be a concert from sunrise to sunset ‚Äî a journey through the emotions of music that moves with the sun,” Vives tells Billboard Espa√±ol . “It will feature a selection of songs, including the most remarkable vallenatos of my career, and pay tribute to classics.” He adds, “In short, Tour al Sol is a concert with the sun of La Provincia.‚Äù Covering 14 cities across North America, his tour will include stops at renowned venues such as Radio City Music Hall in New York, as well as Jazz Fest in New Orleans and will conclude with a special performance at the Coliseo de Puerto Rico Jos√© Miguel Agrelot on June 5. title: Vince Gill To Receive CMA Willie Nelson Lifetime Achievement¬†Award
summary: Vince Gill is an 18-time CMA Award winner, and a former 12-time CMA Awards host.
body: Country Music Hall of Famer Vince Gill will add to his already considerable collection of accolades, when he is honored with the 2025 CMA Willie Nelson lifetime achievement award during the 59th annual CMA Awards, slated for Nov. 19 in Nashville and airing on ABC. This year’s CMA Awards, hosted by Lainey Wilson, will be held at Bridgestone Arena in downtown Nashville, and will broadcast on ABC beginning at 8 p.m. ET. The awards show will also stream the following day on Hulu. The CMA Willie Nelson lifetime achievement award is given to “an iconic artist who has attained the highest degree of recognition in country music,” a release from the CMA states, adding, “The award recognizes those who have achieved both national and international prominence and stature through concert performances, humanitarian efforts, philanthropy, streaming numbers, record sales, and public representation at the highest level,” as well as artists who have “positively impacted and contributed to the growth of the genre over the course of many years.” Previous recipients of the CMA Willie Nelson lifetime achievement award include Johnny Cash (2015), Alan Jackson (2‚Ä¶

The design of the Galaxy S26 Plus features the same double-layered triple camera island inspired by the Galaxy S25 Edge and the Galaxy Z Fold 7. Colors are merely representative at this stage and are not confirmed, and some leakers even state that the orange color currently does not exist for the Galaxy S26 Plus. Samsung‚Äôs Galaxy S26 series strategy has gone through a pre-release shake-up, with the demise of the Galaxy S26 Edge and the revival of the Galaxy S26 Plus. With the Edge no longer in the picture, we now have leaked renders coming in for the Galaxy S26 Plus, with colors that just might be too good to be true. title: Prepare your Steam library: The easiest Windows emulator just hit the Play Store
summary: It's never been easier to play Windows games on Android.
body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority TL;DR The Windows emulator GameHub is now available on the Google Play Store. It plays Windows games via emulation, cloud gaming, or local game streaming. GameHub can also connect to a Steam account for seamless downloads. The Windows emulation scene on Android has been making rapid progress in the past few years, but it wasn‚Äôt until recently that it truly became approachable. GameHub, a new app from the controller company GameSir, streamlines the Windows emulation experience in a way that anyone can understand, and it‚Äôs now available on the Google Play Store starting today . GameHub, which launched earlier this year as GameFusion, is an all-in-one application that allows you to play PC games on your Android device. It can connect to Xbox Cloud Gaming directly from the app, launch local streaming apps like Steam Link, or, most importantly, play Windows games via emulation.

title: Foo Fighters Announce Dates For 2026 Take Cover European Stadium¬†Tour
summary: The run of shows slated to kick off on June 10 in Oslo will feature opening sets from Royel Otis, Inhaler, Idles and others.
body: The Foo Fighters will warm up for their planned run of summer 2026 North American stadium shows with a run of U.K. and European stadium gigs. The Foos’ Take Cover European tour is slated to kick off on June 10 at Oslo, Norway’s Unity Arena. The run of 12 shows will include stops in Stockholm, Warsaw, Munich, Paris, Liverpool, Berlin, Vienna and Milan, before winding down with appearances at the Mad Cool Festival in Madrid, Spain on July 8 and the NOS Alive Festival in Oeiras, Portugal on July 10. Support on the dates will be provided by Royel Otis, Inhaler, IDLES, Otoboke Beaver, Die Spitz and Fat Dog. The general on-sale for the dates will kick off on Friday (Nov. 14) at 10 a.m. local time; click here for more ticketing information. The Foos have been gearing up for a return next year via a series of underplay club shows ‚Äî including last month’s “ Cage Match ” show for Amazon Music Live ‚Äî and the release last month of the hard-hitting new single, “ Asking For a Friend .” The upcoming shows will be the first large-venue gigs with new drummer Ilan Rubin, who left his spot in Nine Inch Nails earlier this year to join the Dave Grohl-led band;‚Ä¶

title: We unboxed the OnePlus 15: Here‚Äôs everything inside

body: TL;DR The OnePlus 15 launches on November 13, and we bring you a glimpse of what you get inside its box. OnePlus has confirmed a bigger 7,300mAh battery, 120W charging, and design changes with the OnePlus 15. The price won‚Äôt be revealed until the launch, but you can register your interest already to avail some freebies. The OnePlus 15 is set to go international later this week , becoming one of the first devices globally to be powered by the new Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5. In classic OnePlus fashion, official teasers about the device have already been gushing in, confirming notable upgrades for the global variant, including its massive 7,300mAh battery ‚Äî a 21% upgrade over the OnePlus 13. As OnePlus prepares to launch the OnePlus 15 globally, it has given us access to the device. While we work on a detailed review for you to see soon, we‚Äôre bringing you a quick unboxing experience of the OnePlus 15. Additionally, we‚Äôre providing a glimpse of the design changes, which align with the Chinese variant launched last month .

title: Jonas Brothers Will Ring in 2026 With New Year‚Äôs Eve Special From¬†Florida
summary: The gig at the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino is part of the trio's partnership with Samsung TV Plus.
body: The Jonas Brothers will ring in the new year in Florida after a 2025 run of shows celebrating their 20th anniversary as a group. Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas will take the stage at the Hard Rock Hotel & Casino on Dec. 31 for a two-hour show slated to kick off at 10 p.m. ET that will be livestreamed exclusively on Samsung TV Plus. “Greetings from 2026 ü©∂ We couldn‚Äôt imagine closing out 2025 anywhere else but with you. Thank you for making this one of the most unforgettable years in our 20-year journey so far,” the group wrote in an Instagram post announcing the gig on Sunday night (Nov. 9). Tickets for the Greetings From 2026 gig will go on sale through an artist pre-sale beginning on Wednesday (Nov. 12) at 10 a.m. ET, followed by a public on-sale on Thursday (Nov. 13) at 10 a.m. ET. If you can’t make it down to the show, you can still watch the gig live on Samsung TV Plus. The show will feature a mix of early hits, fan favorites and songs from their most recent album, Greetings From Your Hometown . ‚Äú2025 will be a year we will always remember, and we couldn‚Äôt think of a better way to kick off the new one than celebrating with our fans,‚Äù the group said in a state‚Ä¶

title: This rumored Samsung credit card may be the next wallet upgrade for Galaxy fans
summary: Samsung could step into Apple Card territory with a new Barclays co-branded credit card.
body: Credit: Joe Hindy / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung is reportedly in advanced talks with Barclays to launch a co-branded Visa credit card in the US. The credit card may offer cashback, which can be redeemed against Samsung products, including phones. In addition to the card, Samsung is also said to be exploring financial products such as high-yield savings, digital prepaid accounts, and BNPL. One of the significant perks of owning an iPhone is that you walk into a seamless ecosystem of convenience. While many people feel suffocated by the walled garden, others appreciate how easy it makes their lives. For instance, iPhone users in the US can apply for an Apple Card, a credit card that is designed primarily for use with Apple Pay on Apple devices. Android doesn‚Äôt have a competing product, but it seems that could soon be changing as Samsung is in talks to launch its own co-branded consumer credit card in the US. title: These 3 features made me drop Chrome for Samsung‚Äôs new PC browser
summary: Not bad for a first go on desktop, Samsung.
body: When I installed Samsung Internet Beta for desktop earlier this week, I wasn‚Äôt expecting much. The Korean company is an established browser builder on Android, but that doesn‚Äôt mean its first desktop browser would be an immediate success. If anything, I was expecting a complete mess of AI fluff, unfocused design, and terrible performance. I couldn‚Äôt have been more wrong. Based on Google Chrome ‚Äôs underpinnings, Samsung Internet Beta is a breath of fresh air. It‚Äôs 2025, and the odd mandatory mention of AI features is present, but Samsung Internet isn‚Äôt an ‚ÄúAI browser‚Äù in the same vein as OpenAI‚Äôs Atlas or Perplexity‚Äôs Comet . It is far more traditional in its philosophy and offers excellent design decisions that improve upon Chrome‚Äôs usability, privacy, and multitasking capabilities.

title: Baseus‚Äô latest Qi2.2 chargers are smaller, faster, and cheaper for Black Friday
summary: Next-gen charging meets Black Friday savings.
body: Credit: Baseus If you‚Äôve recently picked up an iPhone 17 or plan to soon, you might be due for an upgrade to your charger as well. Baseus is one of the biggest names in mobile accessories, and it recently launched its next-gen PicoGo series. As the holiday season rolls around, both devices are already discounted for Black Friday. These are among the first Qi2.2-certified products on the market, offering faster speeds, smarter magnetic alignment, and safer charging for iPhone and Android alike. Qi2.2 offers a max 25W charging speed, making wireless charging as fast as wired. iPhone 16 and 17 models already support it, while Android manufacturers like Google and Samsung are lining up to adopt the standard. For anyone who uses their phone as a work tool, camera, or travel companion, grabbing a compatible charger is a future-proofing move.

title: The Galaxy S26 might close in on Edge territory with key design improvement
summary: The Galaxy S26 could take a design cue from the S25 Edge.
body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR A leaker has revealed that the Galaxy S26 apparently measures 6.9mm thick. That makes it 0.3mm thinner than the already slim Galaxy S25, and significantly thinner than the iPhone 17 and Pixel 10. This would be thicker than the Galaxy S25 Edge (5.8mm), but the S26 is expected to be more capable than the S25 Edge. The Samsung Galaxy S26 series is expected to launch early next year, and we initially expected to see the Galaxy S26 Pro instead of the base Galaxy S26. However, it seems like the base Galaxy S26 will make a return, after all. Now, a tipster has dished out apparent thickness details. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Teardown reveals this new Android flagship is hiding an insane cooling system inside!
summary: JerryRigEverything peeled the REDMAGIC 11 Pro to reveal what might be the coolest liquid cooling system we've ever seen.
body: TL;DR YouTuber JerryRigEverything peeled open the new REDMAGIC 11 Pro to reveal its wild liquid cooling system. You can actually see the phone‚Äôs blue coolant circulating through the whole system. The RedMagic 11 Pro uses an unfreezable, server-grade fluorinated liquid and a piezoelectric micropump to move coolant through a loop. The REDMAGIC 11 Pro , Nubia‚Äôs brand-new gaming phone, is already one of the most eye-catching Android flagships right now. However, it turns out that the phone‚Äôs hidden liquid cooling system might just be its most jaw-dropping feature. In a new YouTube Short, JerryRigEverything‚Äôs Zack Nelson peeled back the rear cover of the phone to show what‚Äôs concealed underneath, and it‚Äôs unlike anything we‚Äôve seen before.

title: I almost ditched Chrome for Samsung‚Äôs new PC browser, but one missing feature is stopping me
summary: I rely on custom search engines too much to use a browser that lacks them.
body: Chrome has been my default browser for a long time, but recently I‚Äôve been looking into alternatives that offer useful new features that Google‚Äôs browser can‚Äôt match. There‚Äôs always one sticking point that leads me to go back to Chrome, and unfortunately, the same can be said for Samsung Internet‚Äôs Windows release . It gets a lot right, but one missing feature is preventing it from becoming my main browser. There‚Äôs a lot to like Credit: Zac Kew-Denniss / Android Authority The feature I love most in Samsung Internet is the split-view mode, along with the sidebar. Split-view puts two tabs side-by-side without having to open a new instance of the tab. The sidebar, as seen in the far right of the image, is a space where you can open a third page in a mobile UI. This has been great for researching and writing articles, as I can have my writing and two research tabs open all in one place without switching windows.

title: The only upgrade I want from a new Kindle Scribe is a foldable design
summary: Portability is all the Scribe is missing.
body: I love my Kindle Scribe , truly. The massive display, paper-like texture, and pen that never needs charging all add up to a convenient, distraction-free space for reading, writing, and pretending my thoughts are more profound than they actually are. But as much as I adore my e-ink notebook-library-in-one, there‚Äôs one thing the Scribe still doesn‚Äôt get right, and that‚Äôs portability. My biggest pipe dream for the line is a foldable design. The Scribe‚Äôs best feature is also its biggest problem

body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BOC83ge2io4 This week, Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown discuss the sweeping changes coming to Android and the Google Play Store thanks to the Epic Games lawsuit settlement, the beginning of the end for Google Assistant on Android, and whether the new Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chip is powerful enough to warrant an upgrade. The Authority Insights Podcast is a new weekly show from the Android Authority team hosted by Mishaal Rahman and C. Scott Brown. title: YouTube Music uploads saved my rare songs ‚Äî here‚Äôs how
summary: Preserving my music library, one upload at a time.
body: Music collecting and appreciation is a deeply personal hobby. It‚Äôs something very important to me and serves as a snapshot of time and place. Over the years, most of us of a certain vintage have built our music libraries piece by piece, from rare digital downloads and fan remixes to songs that never made it to streaming platforms. Even mixtapes if you, like me, are a 90s or earlier kid. For me, those tracks represent more than nostalgia. They‚Äôre a record of growing up online, scouring file-sharing forums for one-off singles, MySpace, and now, an ever-growing collection of vinyl records collected during my travels. Every record I collect tells a story. A dusty Cuban jazz album I picked up in Havana, the Japanese city pop release I stumbled upon in a secondhand store in Shibuya, or the deep techno record from a small label in Berlin that went under decades ago. You catch my drift. These albums aren‚Äôt just music albums, they‚Äôre memories. And yet, when I want to go back to any of them on the go, it‚Äôs not an option. Way too many of them don‚Äôt exist anywhere in the digital domain. Not on Spotify, not on Apple Music, and all too often, not even on YouTube.

title: This new Chrome feature is my favorite productivity hack
summary: It's finally here, and I love it.
body: Chrome‚Äôs new Split View feature allows me to have two tabs open simultaneously, side by side. We first heard about it at the beginning of the year, with users able to test it out in the browser by enabling a Chrome flag a few months ago. It looks like the feature is now live, as it popped up in my browser a few days ago. I‚Äôve been testing it out and am pleased to say it fits into my workflow perfectly. Despite being a simple feature, it has become my favorite Chrome productivity hack by far, helping me get stuff done faster.

title: What I learned after using a Google TV projector in my bedroom for 30 days
summary: The short answer: there‚Äôs a lot of Netflix to be watched.
body: Credit: Kaitlyn Cimino / Android Authority When I finished reviewing the XGIMI Mogo 4 , I figured it would go back in its box after testing. It was bright, portable, and competent, but I already had a TV in the living room and a portable projector for the occasional movie night. I also have an iPad and a smartphone for small-scale viewing. Where else did I really need a screen? The answer, it turns out, was my bedroom. A month later, I learned that convenience can completely change how and where I watch TV. Small space, big screen

title: Gamers take note: Android‚Äôs best emulation frontend just got a significant update
summary: Finally put a number on your gaming obsession with time tracking.
body: TL;DR ES-DE 3.4.0 is out now, adding support for PS3 and Steam gaming. New time statistics let you track your most popular games. Android upgrades include dual-screen improvements and ARMSX2 support. For as fun as emulating games is, it can also get real messy, real fast. Juggling a bunch of different emulators, each targeting different hardware, makes gaming feel more complicated than we‚Äôd like ‚Äî which is exactly why we‚Äôre fans of a good emulation frontend like ES-DE (you can even run it as your launcher ). Today we‚Äôre getting a nice upgrade to start off our gaming weekend, as ES-DE delivers some useful new features and Android support for additional systems. title: Fitbit‚Äôs food logging is broken right now, but that‚Äôs no excuse for a cheat day
summary: Users are hungry for a fix while Fitbit sorts out the mess.
body: TL;DR Fitbit‚Äôs food-logging tools, including search and barcode scanning, are down for many Android and iOS users. Recent and frequent foods still work, but new items can only be added manually with limited nutrition data. Fitbit says engineers are investigating the server-side issue, but there‚Äôs no ETA on a fix yet. Fitbit is more than just a step-tracking watch . In fact, it also helps millions stay on top of their daily nutrition. But if you tried logging meals today and found the search bar empty or the barcode scanner unresponsive, you‚Äôre not alone. According to multiple reports , Fitbit‚Äôs food-logging system is experiencing a widespread outage affecting both Android and iOS users. Over the past 24 hours, people who rely on Fitbit‚Äôs food database or barcode scanner have been unable to search for new items or scan packaged goods. Favorites and recent entries still appear in the Log Food section, but trying to look up anything new typically results in a blank screen or a ‚Äúfitbit.com is down for maintenance‚Äù pop-up. Support reps have confirmed this isn‚Äôt an isolated glitch and say engineers are actively investigating the issue.

title: Google Wallet adding new ‚Äòpurchase and pass‚Äô personalization settings
summary: Upcoming Google Wallet settings will provide a ‚Äúnew way for you to get more personalized recommendations‚Äù from your ‚Äúpurchase and pass‚Äù history. more‚Ä¶

title: This upcoming Google Play Store change could make app reviews actually useful
summary: Google might finally let you search through user-submitted reviews.
body: TL;DR Play Store reviews can be a useful resource for learning about apps, but they lack a search tool. You can currently filter reviews by score, date, or even specific topics, but you can‚Äôt add new topics yourself. It‚Äôs not yet functional, but some new code strings in the Play Store app suggest that Google‚Äôs working on a review search tool. Reviews have to be one of the most frustrating-to-navigate components of life online ‚Äî one that we nonetheless find ourselves returning to time and time again. When you don‚Äôt know exactly what the best option for you is just yet, a good user review can really be illuminating. But finding that good one can sometimes require trudging through screens of low-quality submissions, AI slop, and even the work of paid shills. If you‚Äôre looking for some help finding the one review that really speaks to your needs, the Google Play Store appears to be working on a tool that might be right up your alley. title: After devastating typhoon, one phone survived flooding and three days in the mud
summary: A tragic story from the Philippines shows both human resilience and surprising phone durability.
body: Credit: Reddit TL;DR A Philippines resident says their phone survived floodwaters and three days buried in mud after Typhoon Kalmaegi destroyed their home. The iPhone 17 Pro Max worked fine after charging, despite the other devastating impacts of the natural disaster. While the user‚Äôs own survival is what matters, the story again highlights the durability of modern devices, following earlier examples of Android endurance. When Typhoon Kalmaegi tore through the Philippines this week, it left catastrophic damage in its wake. Tragically, many lives were lost, entire homes were destroyed, and communities were left to rebuild from scratch. Amidst the devastation, one Reddit user shared an incredible story of their own survival, as well as that of their iPhone, adding to a growing list of phones that have beaten the survival odds recently. title: Bug or feature? YouTube Shorts bug removes all buttons for a super clean experience
summary: Many users can't see any interaction buttons or creator info on the Shorts pane.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR A widespread bug is causing the YouTube Shorts interface to vanish for mobile users. Missing elements include the like, dislike, comment, share, and creator information buttons. Users have tried common fixes, such as reinstalling the app, but the issue persists. A few weeks ago, YouTube began rolling out its latest redesign to Android users, regardless of whether they liked it or not. If you hated the new design and just wished it were gone, then a new YouTube bug is granting you your wish, as users now complain that the Shorts interface has disappeared for them on mobile. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: LG‚Äôs 3-in-1 MoodMate projector brings color, sound, and streaming to your living room
summary: Set a screening or just set the mood.
body: TL;DR LG launched its new MoodMate 3-in-1 device, combining a projector, mood lamp, and Bluetooth speaker. It projects up to 120 inches at 1080p and 300 lumens of output, or lights up in nine colors at five brightness levels. Though launched in South Korea, wider rollout is expected later this year under the CineBeam M lineup. LG‚Äôs newest home projector isn‚Äôt content just projecting movies. The LG MoodMate wants to be your big screen, mood light, and Bluetooth speaker all at once. It features a unique design that blurs the line between home theater and lifestyle gadget. Launched in South Korea, the MoodMate is a standing projector with a design LG says was inspired by floor lamps. It boasts a compact, portable unit capable of projecting images up to 120 inches at Full HD (1080p) with specs including 300 ANSI lumens of brightness and HDR support. It‚Äôs powered by LG‚Äôs webOS platform for built-in streaming apps and features HDMI and USB ports for external connections. With a 1.2:1 throw ratio, auto correction features, and an upright, space-saving build, it‚Äôs easy to reposition from room to room.

title: Back Tap not reliable on your Samsung phone? This Good Lock update is for you.
summary: Not happy with Back Tap functionality on your Samsung phone? The latest RegiStar update should help.
body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung has released an update to the RegiStar Good Lock app. The update improves the reliability of the Back Tap feature. This update also fixes an issue when launching Gemini on your Flip phone‚Äôs cover screen. Some Android phones let you double-tap the back cover to activate various features, and Galaxy phones are no exception. Samsung users need to download the RegiStar Good Lock app to access this function, and the company has just updated the app for more reliable back taps. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Google Messages will soon save you from opening web pages ‚Äî here‚Äôs how Insights will work
summary: We've spotted the exact instructions that will be passed on to Gemini to generate Insights summary.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR The upcoming ‚ÄúInsights‚Äù feature in Google Messages will use Gemini to provide a concise, three-point summary of shared links. The feature will be able to use both the provided link information and external web searches, and it will notify the user if it retrieves data from outside sources. Dual-SIM users will soon get a clearer interface, with the SIM carrier name returning to the compose box. When we previously spotted Google Messages‚Äô upcoming Insights feature , there were barely any clues about its functionality. We presumed that Insights would provide a quick summary of the web page, and to that extent, our presumption is correct. We now have more details about the output you can expect when you press the Insights button, as well as other changes that Google is working on in the Messages app. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. title: Samsung should not release the Galaxy Z Fold 8 if it‚Äôs missing these 2 features
summary: I fear Samsung's eye will be on the TriFold and it will adopt the laziest attitude for the Z Fold 8.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority During its quarterly earnings conference call last week , Samsung teased a bunch of changes, better chips, more AI innovation, and upgraded cameras to keep its shareholders happy. Among those pledges was a focus on how well the Galaxy Z Fold 7 has been doing in terms of sales and public reception, and a vague promise to keep innovating within the foldable lineup and ‚Äúprovide new experiences.‚Äù I‚Äôm sure Samsung is subtly hinting at its upcoming Galaxy Z TriFold with its impressive tablet-and-phone design, but I do hope the allure of a hot new form factor doesn‚Äôt let the Korean giant forget about its existing Fold line-up. The Galaxy Z Fold 7 has already impressed us, but it still needs two major upgrades next year, and I don‚Äôt think Samsung should rest on its laurels or skip them.

title: Leakers just can‚Äôt agree if the Galaxy S26 Ultra‚Äôs cameras are an upgrade or a downgrade
summary: Making matters more confusing than ever.
body: TL;DR A noted leaker has contradicted a recent rumor about the Galaxy S26 Ultra‚Äôs camera. According to Ice Universe, the Galaxy S26 Ultra‚Äôs 3x telephoto will be downgraded ‚Äî and not upgraded, as was recently suggested. They say these changes are made to accommodate the slimmer profile of the upcoming Samsung flagship. There are two cadres of Android flagships. In the first category, brands such as OnePlus work tirelessly to make each new phone appear radically different from its predecessor. In the other category, brands such as Samsung reiterate a proven formula and introduce a new phone with some internal changes and minimal cosmetic variations. In the case of the Galaxy S26, too, we‚Äôre witnessing the same pattern repeated, where only minor optimization-oriented tweaks are, once again, expected to take priority over anything radical. That also holds for the camera we see on the Galaxy S26 Ultra, which is expected to undergo only minimal variations ‚Äî or so we thought until yesterday, when a leak hinted at one of the four cameras being upgraded . That may turn out to be untrue, as reputed leaker Ice Universe has strongly opposed these leaks.

title: Gemini on Google Home is here ‚Äî how‚Äôs it working out for you?
summary: We want to hear from you. What are your thoughts about Google Home‚Äôs upgraded assistant?
body: This is an open thread. We want to hear from you! Share your thoughts in the comments and vote in the poll below ‚Äî your take might be featured in a future roundup.

title: I tried to love Gemini Live ahead of its Google Home debut, but I can‚Äôt imagine paying for it
summary: Google's Gemini Live is still not dependable, one year on.
body: Credit: Prakhar Khanna / Android Authority With Gemini slowly but finally rolling out to Google‚Äôs smart speakers and displays, I‚Äôve found myself filled with renewed optimism for my stack of devices. The search giant has stripped the platform of countless features over the past couple of years, and even some basic voice commands have failed to function like they once did. I‚Äôm not alone ‚Äî hundreds of users have voiced the same complaint about Google Home across social media. Luckily, Gemini looks like it‚Äôs on track to revive Google Home‚Äôs usefulness but I‚Äôm equally concerned that it will introduce problems of its own. Given that I already have Google‚Äôs AI Pro subscription , I‚Äôm also looking forward to using Gemini Live ‚Äî the two-way voice conversation feature that won‚Äôt require a wakeword every single time. However, after extensively using it on my phone, my excitement levels for the feature‚Äôs expansion have been significantly dampened.

title: iPhone 18 Pro leak suggests Apple could copy Nothing with this key design choice
summary: Apple's next iPhones might take a page out of the Nothing playbook for this design choice.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR A leaker has claimed that the iPhone 18 Pro series would have transparent rear covers. This would come years after Nothing, HTC, and Xiaomi offered devices with transparent or translucent rear covers. It‚Äôs also believed that the iPhone 18 Pro line could get punch-hole cutouts and a variable aperture main camera. The iPhone 17 series is roughly two months old, but we‚Äôve already heard several iPhone 18 series rumors. Now, a trusted leaker has suggested that the iPhone 18 Pro line could get a design feature seen on devices like the Nothing Phone series. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: One UI 8.5‚Äôs notification summaries may not be to everyone‚Äôs delight
summary: And could especially disappoint multilingual users.
body: TL;DR Samsung is bringing notification summarization and prioritization features with One UI 8.5, but we‚Äôve discovered certain limitations. These features will only work in the device‚Äôs default language, likely disappointing for multilingual users. One UI 8.5 may also bring scam detection that would analyze phone calls using AI for any fraudulent activity, though this feature may be limited to Korea initially. Samsung‚Äôs upcoming One UI 8.5 update is expected to bring significant reforms to the Quick Settings and notifications on eligible Samsung devices. In addition to the visual changes, the update is also likely to bring iOS-like notifications summaries and prioritization features . While useful, these features may not please every user. title: Sharing YouTube clips in Google Messages may be about to get a lot better
summary: Messages starts testing the return of a missing YouTube feature.
body: TL;DR Google Messages offered an integrated picture-in-picture YouTube viewer up until mid-2024. Earlier this year we uncovered signs that Google was working to restore this functionality. The PiP YouTube player has now started appearing for some Messages beta testers. When we spot Google working on a new feature for one of its apps, it‚Äôs often anyone‚Äôs guess just how long we‚Äôll have to wait before it‚Äôs ready to go live ‚Äî assuming it even does at all. That can be a matter of days, weeks, months, or longer. Today we‚Äôve got some good news about a long-ago-spotted upgrade that finally looks like it‚Äôs nearly ready for prime time, as it starts hitting beta testers. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Pebblebee‚Äôs new Find Hub trackers add wireless charging and limited-edition colors
summary: These are some solid improvements to Pebblebee's Clip and Card trackers.
body: TL;DR Pebblebee is now selling two new trackers: The Clip 5 and the Card 5. Both trackers come marked with QR codes to make it easy to return lost items. The new Card 5 is even thinner than previous models and supports wireless charging. Google‚Äôs Find Hub got off to a rough start, but as time‚Äôs gone on, the network has become more useful and we‚Äôve seen a wider variety of tracker hardware. Today, one of the earliest manufacturers of Find Hub trackers, Pebblebee, is selling a couple of new trackers that come with some interesting perks. Pebblebee has started sales of new versions of its Clip and Card trackers. They‚Äôre both compatible with Google‚Äôs Find Hub as well as Apple Find My, and unlike many previous Pebblebee trackers, neither requires a proprietary charger. They‚Äôre also marked with QR codes that let anyone who finds them contact you to return your lost item.

title: Here‚Äôs why I would get the Apple Watch SE 2 on sale instead of the Watch SE 3
summary: I still love my Apple Watch SE 2, and you might too!
body: Credit: Kaitlyn Cimino / Android Authority I still use the Apple Watch SE 2, and I honestly feel no need to upgrade to the brand-new model. If you‚Äôre looking to get one of Apple‚Äôs affordable wearables, you might want to consider the previous-generation one, as it is currently at a $89.01 discount. Buy the Apple Watch SE 2 for just $159.99 ($89.01 off)

title: Apple‚Äôs first foldable iPhone could be a major leap for under-display selfie cams
summary: JP Morgan reportedly expects it'll use a 24-megapixel sensor under its inner screen.
body: TL;DR The first folding iPhone could come with a 24-megapixel under-display selfie camera. Samsung‚Äôs latest Z Fold 7 moved away from the under-display selfie cameras previous models used. Apple‚Äôs first foldable could launch in the second half of 2026. Smartphone manufacturers tend to get ideas from each other. Once Samsung or Google or Apple proves an idea is technically viable and, more importantly, marketable, the other players often move to implement it in their own products. Following the success of folding phones from the likes of Samsung and OPPO, Apple is reportedly working on a foldable of its own. We‚Äôve known that for a while, but now, we‚Äôve seen more evidence that suggests the first folding iPhone will use an under-display camera embedded in its internal display. We first heard that the foldable iPhone would feature an under-display camera by way of a May leak . Samsung‚Äôs Galaxy Z Fold phones used similar technology through the Z Fold 6 until switching to a more conventional hole-punch design in the Z Fold 7. On balance, this was probably the right move ‚Äî the Z Fold 6‚Äôs under-display camera used a four-megapixel sensor, making for a selfie camera that just wasn‚Äôt very go‚Ä¶

title: Google Finance wants to become your smartest investing assistant with these new features
summary: Deep Search gets you answers to comprehensive questions, while prediction market support will be clutch for future analysis.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google has added Deep Search to the new Google Finance experience, offering comprehensive answers via Gemini. Google Finance will also include prediction market data from Kalshi and Polymarket for future event analysis. These features are rolling out in the US, but the new experience is also expanding to the Indian market, offering support in both English and Hindi. Google added a new live earnings experience to Google Finance beta last week, bringing live audio streams, instant transcripts, and AI-powered summaries that explain the key takeaways from company results. The company isn‚Äôt stopping there, as today, Google has announced that Google Finance is getting support for Deep Search and prediction markets, and the new Finance experience is expanding to a new market. It saves me time and makes my food much more delicious! That said, it can be a bit of a pricey endeavor, so it‚Äôs nice to find good deals like today‚Äôs Anova Precision Cooker 3.0 sale. title: Google Messages doubles its pin limit, in case you‚Äôre avoiding more than 10 people
summary: A small update for Google Messages, a big win for procrastinators.
body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority TL;DR Google Messages now lets you have up to 20 pinned conversations, up from the previous limit of 10. The expanded limit appears to be rolling out in the latest version of the app. Pinning keeps important chats visible, but if you‚Äôve got 20 pinned, it might be time to reply to a few. Sometimes you get one of those texts that you don‚Äôt want to reply to right away, but also don‚Äôt want to forget about entirely as more messages arrive. That‚Äôs where pinned conversations come in handy, keeping your most important threads at the top of your inbox so they don‚Äôt get buried under new ones. Google Messages has long offered the pinned conversations feature, but now it‚Äôs turning it up to 11 ‚Äî or, more accurately, to 20. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: UGREEN Uno Charger 30W drops back to record-low price!
summary: This is my favorite charger, just because of its design!
body: Credit: UGREEN While often overlooked, I believe it is crucial to get a good experience out of a charger. After all, it is the tech gadget I use the most, after my smartphone. The UGREEN Uno Charger 30W is one of my favorite models, just because it is so fun, and it‚Äôs also at a record-low price right now. Buy the UGREEN Uno Charger 30W for just $17.98 ($12.01 off)

title: Spotify‚Äôs new listening stats are here to tide you over until Wrapped season
summary: Now you can show off your taste in music every week.
body: TL;DR Spotify now offers shareable weekly listening stats. Listening stats highlight which artists and tracks you‚Äôve listened to the most each seven days. The feature is available beginning today for free and Premium users in many countries. Spotify Wrapped kicks off a flurry of social media activity every December as users share their year-end listening stats. Now, Spotify‚Äôs getting a new feature that offers a little bit of that experience on demand, whenever you want it. In a blog post this morning, Spotify announced that the app is getting a weekly listening stats feature. These weekly stats aren‚Äôt delivered in as glossy a package as the once-a-year Wrapped, which comes with a slick multimedia slideshow. Instead, your listening stats highlight which artists and tracks you‚Äôve listened to the most in each seven-day period in a simpler, but still shareable, format.

title: T-Mobile will give you 4 lines and 4 phones for $25 per line, no trade-ins required
summary: You'll need to jump ship from AT&T or Verizon to get in on this one, though.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is offering four lines and four phones for $25 per line with no trade-ins required. The deal is only available to switchers coming from Verizon or AT&T. Customers can choose between a free iPhone 17 or Galaxy S25 on the entry-level Essentials plan. Recently, I released an article on what I thought were the five best T-Mobile deals available , but it turns out I missed one because it didn‚Äôt exist yet. T-Mobile was saving its best offer for last it seems, as it has announced a few new holiday deals. Chief among these offers is a promotion that gives you four lines and four phones for $25 per line , all without any trade-ins required. This deal gives you the choice between an iPhone 17 or a Galaxy S25. You might be thinking that T-Mobile already offered these phones for free without a trade-in. That‚Äôs true, but previously, you needed a higher-tier plan.

title: Niagara Launcher softens its minimalist core with new vivid themes
summary: And specially illustrated wallpapers that don't lose their essence to the app list.
body: Credit: Niagara Launcher TL;DR Niagara Launcher is receiving a new visual update, featuring a range of new themes and wallpapers. Unlike traditional minimalist wallpapers, Niagara is bringing several new intricately designed illustrations for wallpapers. The update also improves backup features and adds Bing as a search engine option. Niagara Launcher is one of the most distinct Android launchers , and its impact extends beyond its visual characteristics. Having used it for over two years, I can confirm that it alters ‚Äî in a good way ‚Äî how you approach the app drawer. I now install it on all the phones I review and strongly recommend it too. However, there‚Äôs one aspect that keeps me from feeling completely satisfied, which is the limitation of using wallpapers of my choice. The launcher‚Äôs peculiar design for the app list makes it difficult to use visually rich wallpapers, but this issue may be getting addressed with a new update. In July, the developers of the launcher introduced a new theme playground , enabling users to experiment with various clock styles, wallpapers, and colors. Now, Niagara Launcher is getting another visual upgrade with a host of new themes, icon packs, wall‚Ä¶

title: I left my mirrorless camera at home for the fireworks and don‚Äôt regret it
summary: Can my phone's camera really compete with my mirrorless when shooting in the dark?
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority Bonfire Night in the UK presents budding photographers with a wealth of opportunities for capturing fun snaps. Usually, I‚Äôd take my Fuji mirrorless along to snap some neat pictures of our local bonfire and skies full of delightful fireworks. But this year, with two boundless toddlers to shepherd, I decided I‚Äôd probably need both hands free and would have to rely on my smartphone for quick snaps instead. On the plus side, I‚Äôd been looking for an excuse to test out the dedicated ‚ÄúFireworks‚Äù mode in the OnePlus 13 and OPPO Find X8 Pro (I‚Äôm using the latter) camera apps. The mode seems to combine long and short exposures, providing vivid detail with well-exposed lighting and colors. Given that I probably wouldn‚Äôt have time to optimize shutter speed and ISO while keeping an eye on the little ones, this mode would do all the heavy lifting for me.

title: OnePlus 15‚Äôs massive battery and fast charging are going global
summary: At 7,300mAh capacity, the OnePlus 15 sets the stage for multi-day battery life.
body: TL;DR The OnePlus 15 is set to launch globally on November 13, with specs matching those of the Chinese variant. Key confirmed features include a 7,300mAh battery, 120W wired charging, and 50W wireless charging. The phone will also feature multiple industry-leading durability ratings: IP66, IP68, IP69, and IP69K. The OnePlus 15 was launched in China last month and is set to launch globally on November 13 . Ahead of its official launch, OnePlus has confirmed key specifications that will make its way to the global market, specifically in the areas of battery and charging. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Galaxy S26 may bring these new camera features, even without major hardware upgrades
summary: By upgrading a lesser known app that supercharges the camera on any Galaxy flagship.
body: Credit: Android Headlines TL;DR The Galaxy S26 might receive notable camera upgrades, even without many changes to the hardware. Samsung is rumored to bring more features to Camera Assistant, an app that unlocks hidden Camera settings on Galaxy phones. Among other features, we could see the option to click pictures at 24MP by default instead of the existing 12MP or 50MP modes. Samsung‚Äôs Galaxy S26 series appears to have kept Samsung busier than usual. While the lineup was slated to receive an overhaul with new product names, the changes were reportedly quashed recently, forcing Samsung to return to the older classification . And all this toiling may have contributed to a delayed launch and fewer upgrades to the Galaxy S26 series than we had hoped , especially in the camera department. While the camera itself isn‚Äôt receiving any significant upgrades, some of the software features supporting it are expected to improve. One way we can see this improvement is by adding additional camera settings options to Samsung phones through a first-party extension.

title: E-reader fans want to bring back the book look, ignoring what made Kindles great
summary: I'm not heartless, but nostalgia shouldn‚Äôt dictate design.
body: There‚Äôs a wave of e-reader innovation on the rise, but one specific direction baffles me: dual-screened e-readers that fold like a paperback. While the prospect of having an e-reader that emulates the original two-fold book design seems fun, I absolutely loathe the idea of having two halves by choice, necessitating that I either use two hands or flex my fingers across the hinged gutter. The book-shaped comeback no one asked for

title: I‚Äôve used a hundred phone cases and I‚Äôd never recommend the official Pixel 10 case
summary: Lint today, slipperiness tomorrow, long-term durability problems ‚Äî this isn't a case worth $50.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Since the early 2010s and my HTC Desire Z, I‚Äôve bought and used over a hundred different phone cases, with various materials and designs, all ranging from the cheapest to the super expensive. I‚Äôve had thin hard shells, bulky Otterbox armors, flip-case leather, faux-leather, aramide fiber, TPU, slimy and transparent, colorful and rigid ‚Äî you name it. Recently, every year or two, I‚Äôve also tried Google‚Äôs official case for my Pixel phones just to see if it was worth using, and every time I did, it started well and ended in disappointment. I didn‚Äôt learn my lesson. I just bought the official Pixelsnap case for my Pixel 10 Pro XL (), and although there‚Äôs a lot to love here, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to anyone. Here‚Äôs why.

title: Shop Gifts Curated by Eater Editors at Macy‚Äôs Holiday Square

To help shoppers check off their lists, Macy‚Äôs teamed up with editors from Vox Media brands including Eater, The Cut, and PS to put toge‚Ä¶

title: South Indian Lobster and Caribbean Goat: How I Eat Around New York City
